Now that the World Wide Web has all but killed the newspaper business, and print journalism struggles to find its nice, I often wonder what happened to all of those people who used to EDIT stories before ever releasing them to be published? Editors used to perform a lot of valuable service, acting as a final check on the quality and writing of the stories that appeared under the banner of their company's logo. They would make sure facts were checked, opinions were not stated as facts, and both grammar and punctuation were used correctly so that the output was clear, readable,  and well-written.
